newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Central Bank to continue running Banespa.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Central Bank to continue running Banespa.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank said on Friday it will extend its management of Sao Paulo state bank Banespa for 180 days.

The decision was formalized by Central Bank president Gustavo Loyola following a decree on the restructuring of state banks that was reissued last week. The decree allows the Central Bank to run state banks whose governments have reached a debt deal with the federal government or that are in the process of privatizing.
An agreement allowing the Central Bank to run Rio de Janeiro state bank Banerj was also announced later in the day.
The Central Bank initially took over Banerj and Banespa in December 1994 to run the two banks for one year, but its management was extended for 12 more months.
The Central Bank's period of administration of Banespa and Banerj would have expired late this year. It could only be extended by government decree.
((-- Fatima Cristina, Rio de Janeiro Newsroom 5521 5074151))
